content: i ve already uploaded a video tutorial in youtube for this stitch https //www youtube com/watch v=r1k3l2reka0 1 this is a headband inspired by the flowery and whimsical world of the 1970s it is knitted with double-pointed needles but can be knitted with circular or straight needles the flowers are crocheted and are a complement that you will knit apart from the headband they are an extra but without the flowers the headband also looks very nice it is beginner friendly it is a rectangular design that once knitted you will sew to form the circle this size is a standard size but i suggest you to measure the contour of your head to see if the measurements fit you it is composed of 4 row that are repeated forming the spikes the first 2 row are for preparation therefore you are only going to knit them at the beginning of the garment the first stitch is always a slip_stitch except for the very first row with one skein you can knit a headband and have some yarn left over to crochet some flowers if you want to add flowers of other colours like in the photos you have to take as many skeins as different colors you want to use to crochet them in this pattern 4 different colours have been used one for the headband and the other 3 to form the flowers 1 https //www youtube com/watch v=r1k3l2reka0
